intro: Atalaya, commonly known as the "tree of life," is a deciduous tree native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and showy, fragrant flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant is known for its medicinal properties, with various parts used in traditional medicine to treat ailments such as inflammation and digestive issues. Its bark and leaves contain compounds with antioxidant and anti-inflammatory effects. Atalaya also plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, providing shelter and food for a variety of wildlife.
